Name: Anseba
Description: Anseba is located in the central part of Eritrea. It is known for its agricultural activities, particularly the cultivation of cereals and vegetables.

Name: Debub
Description: Debub is located in the southern part of Eritrea. It includes the port city of Massawa and is a major economic region due to its proximity to the Red Sea.

Name: Gash-Barka
Description: Gash-Barka is situated in the western part of Eritrea. It is a diverse region known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of crops like sorghum and maize.

Name: Maekel
Description: Maekel is the central region of Eritrea, home to the capital city, Asmara. It is the political and cultural heart of the country.

Name: Northern Red Sea
Description: Northern Red Sea is located along the eastern coast of Eritrea, along the Red Sea. It is an important region for fishing and has several islands, including the Dahlak Archipelago.

Name: Southern Red Sea
Description: Southern Red Sea is the southeastern region of Eritrea. It is home to various coastal towns and is important for its maritime economy.
